p: A second urgent need quickly followed. Without the ability to rapidly and inexpensively monitor randomly selected individuals for infectious virus (e.g., via molecular nucleic acid tests) or evidence of prior exposure (via antibody tests), the ability to quickly isolate or quarantine contagious individuals simply did not exist. The only option was simplistic and involved indiscriminate isolation (city-wide stay-at-home, shutdown, or lock-down policies) and physical distancing practices for entire populations â€” to discourage the congregation of people beyond those they live with.
